label: methylKit
info: DNA methylation analysis from high-throughput bisulfite sequencing results

categories.label: Input
categories.info: data files used in the analysis

input_treatment.label: treatment
input_treatment.info: a vector contatining 0, 1 and etc. denoting sample conditions

input_destrand.label: merge both strands
input_destrand.info: if TRUE, reads covering both strands of a CpG dinucleotide will be merged, do not set to TRUE if not only interested in CpGs (default: FALSE). If the methylRawList object contains regions rather than bases setting destrand to TRUE will have no effect.

categories.label: filtering
categories.info: filter samples based on read coverage

input_locount.label: low count
input_locount.info: An integer for read counts. Bases/regions having lower coverage than this count is discarded.

input_hicount.label: high count
input_hicount.info: An integer for read counts. Bases/regions having higher coverage than this is count discarded.

input_loperc.label: low percentage
input_loperc.info: A double [0-100] for percentile of read counts. Bases/regions having lower coverage than this percentile is discarded.

input_hiperc.label: high percentage
input_hiperc.info: A double [0-100] for percentile of read counts. Bases/regions having higher coverage than this percentile is discarded.

categories.label: tiling window
categories.info: summarize methylation information over tiling windows rather than doing base-pair resolution analysis

input_winsize.label: size
input_winsize.info: an integer for the size of the tiling windows

input_stepsize.label: step size
input_stepsize.info: an integer for the step size of tiling windows

input_covbase.label: min of bases
input_covbase.info: minimum number of bases to be covered in a given window

categories.label: Correlation and Clustering
categories.info: checking the sample correlation and clustering the samples based on the methylation profiles

input_cormethod.label: correlation method
input_cormethod.info: which correlation coefficient (or covariance) is to be computed

input_dist.label: distance measure
input_dist.info: the distance measure to be used for clustering

input_clustermethod.label: clustering method
input_clustermethod.info: the agglomeration method to be used

input_sdfilter.label: filter out low variation
input_sdfilter.info: For clustering, if TRUE, the bases/regions with low variation will be discarded prior to clustering

input_sdthreshold.label: sd threshold
input_sdthreshold.info: For clustering, if filterByQuantile is TRUE, features whose standard deviations is less than the quantile denoted by sd.threshold will be removed. If filterByQuantile is FALSE, then features whose standard deviations is less than the value of sd.threshold will be removed.

input_filterbyquantile.label: filter by quantile
input_filterbyquantile.info: For clustering, a logical determining if sd threshold is to be interpreted as a quantile of all Standard Deviation values from bases/regions (true), or as an absolute value.

input_scale.label: scale
input_scale.info: For PCA, if we should scale the data to have unit variance or not.

input_center.label: center
input_center.info: For PCA, if we should center the data or not.

input_transpose.label: transpose
input_transpose.info: For PCA, if TRUE (default) percent methylation matrix will be transposed, this is equivalent to doing PCA on variables that are regions/bases. The resulting plot will location of samples in the new coordinate system if FALSE the variables for the matrix will be samples and the resulting plot whill show how each sample (variable) contributes to the principle component.the samples that are highly correlated should have similar contributions to the principal components.

input_difference.label: cutoff
input_difference.info: cutoff for absolute value of methylation change between test and control

input_qvalue.label: qvalue cutoff
input_qvalue.info: cutoff for qvalue of differential methylation statistic

input_slim.label: SLIM
input_slim.info: If TRUE(default) SLIM method will be used for P-value adjustment. If FALSE, p.adjust with BH method will be used for P-value correction.

input_weightedmean.label: weighted mean
input_weightedmean.info: calculate the mean methylation difference between groups using read coverage as weights

input_annotation.label: annotation file
input_annotation.info: location of the bed file with 12 or more columns

input_cpgannotation.label: CpG island annotation file
input_cpgannotation.info: location of the bed file of the feature

input_flank.label: flank
input_flank.info: number of basepairs for the flanking regions

input_clean.label: clean
input_clean.info: If set to TRUE, flanks overlapping with other main features will be trimmed

input_removeunsual.label: remove unsual
input_removeunsual.info: remove chromsomes with unsual names random, Un and antyhing with _ character

input_strand.label: strand
input_strand.info: If set to TRUE, annotation features and target features will be overlapped based on strand

output_all.label: all bases
output_all.info: all bases with their pvalue, qvalue, methylation difference, type and etc.

output_diff.label: all differentially methylated bases
output_diff.info: all differentially methylated bases with their pvalue, qvalue, methylation difference, type and etc.

output_hyper.label: hyper methylated bases
output_hyper.info: hyper methylated bases with their pvalue, qvalue, methylation difference, type and etc.

output_hypo.label: hypo methylated bases
output_hypo.info: hypo methylated bases with their pvalue, qvalue, methylation difference, type and etc.

output_anndiff.label: all differentially methylated bases with annotation
output_anndiff.info: all differentially methylated bases with their pvalue, qvalue, methylation difference, type, distance to TSS (transcription start site) and nearest gene name, overlap status of the methylation events with the annotation such as promoter/exon/intron and etc
